appendix.title: How to package and release OpenACS

listitem.para: Check out the cvs tree. The files must be checked out through a cvs account with write access. In this example, the cvs user on openacs.org is implied from the ssh login information previously set up. It could be overridden via foobar@openacs.org.
Repeat with the dotlrn cvs tree.

screen.action: cd /tmp mkdir dotlrn-packages cd dotlrn-packages cvs -d :ext:@dotlrn@openacs.org:/dotlrn-cvsroot checkout dotlrn-all

listitem.para: Tag dotLRN. Since the dotLRN packages aren't all in one module, we iterate through all of the modules. Log in first (cvs login) so that you don't have to log in for each module.
Go to a new working space and export the tagged files.

screen.action: mkdir /tmp/tarball cd /tmp/tarball cvs export -r openacs-5-0-0a1 -d openacs acs-core
cd /tmp/tarball rm -rf /tmp/tarball/openacs/CVS tar cz -f openacs-5.0.0a1.tar.gz openacs

listitem.para: Go to a new working space and export the tagged files.

screen.action: mkdir /tmp/dotlrn-tarball cd /tmp/dotlrn-tarball cvs export -d :pserver:anonymous@openacs.org:/cvsroot \ -r openacs-5-0-0a1 -d openacs acs-core cd packages cvs export -d :pserver:anonymous@openacs.org:/cvsroot \ -r openacs-5-0-0a1 -d openacs dotlrn-prereq cvs export -d :pserver:anonymous@dotlrn.openacs.org:/dotlrn-cvsroot \ -r dotlrn-2.0.0a1 dotlrn-core

listitem.para: Copy the dotlrn install.xml file, which controls which packages are installed on setup, to the root location:

screen.action: cd /tmp/tarball rm -rf /tmp/tarball/openacs-4/CVS tar cz -f dotlrn-2.0.0a1.tar.gz openacs
